item.title: Boneheaded aphorisms from Davos's windy summit - FT.com
item.description:
Boneheaded aphorisms from Davos's windy summit - FT.com

You can always go faster than you think you can. Those are not my words. They are the words of , Hewlett-Packard Enterprise chief executive, who said them about 10 days ago at Davos, where they were duly jotted down and published in a collection of

item.title: Genève bannit les OGM de son agriculture
item.description:
Genève bannit les OGM de son agriculture

Le Parlement genevois a décidé, à l'unanimité, ce vendredi de bannir la culture d'organismes et la détention d'animaux de rente génétiquement modifiés (OGM) sur le territoire cantonal. Proposée par les Verts, la législation vise deux objectifs: protéger le canton de l'utilisation d'OGM dans son agriculture lorsque le moratoire existant au niveau national prendra fin en 2017 et adresser un message aux Chambre fédérales pour qu'il légifère sur cette question.

item.title: Knock on effects of mega-regionals
item.description:
Knock on effects of mega-regionals

#Megaregionals and impact on #latinamerica #trade a mixed picture at best; but in the long run perhaps a losing proposition for #Brazil, particularly. Although low exposure to trade the downside won't be visible until agreements are in place.

item.title: 3D printing will disrupt manufacturing - | GE Look ahead | The Economist
item.description:
3D printing will disrupt manufacturing - | GE Look ahead | The Economist

Hard to believe that digitalisation might affect manufacturing to the same extent it has affected and changed media. Record shops did not survive the digital reproduction of music: the last Virgin Megastore in the US closed five years ago, following the earlier demise of many thousands of smaller retailers.

item.title: The beauty and bawdiness of medieval playing cards
item.description:
The beauty and bawdiness of medieval playing cards

The beauty and bawdiness of medieval playing cards LIFE in the Middle Ages was not all work, plagues and prayers. People also had fun, despite government and church efforts to stop them. One of the most popular medieval amusements is the subject of "The World in Play: Luxury Cards 1430-1540", at the Cloisters Museum in New York.
